Reviews.Title: “great value for your money...”
Reviews.Author: fyrebrat
Reviews.Content: We've had overnight stays in this hotel whenever we have an event to attend in Dubai... it was always a pleasant stay... not something to write home about but in Dubai where everything is ridiculously inflated, this hotel gives you what your money is worth.. the rooms are clean and big enough.. reception was always friendly and accommodating... they always allow us late check out...we havent tried breakfast (i'm not sure if they offer...) Al Barsha area is pretty okay as it's near the Mall of Emirates, not yet entirely inside the city (so you avoid the traffic and crowd) and also near the Palm Jumeirah.. Could be a bit hard to locate the hotel as Al Barsha Area (back of MoE) looks like a maze with tons of other hotels and streets that look similar (lots of roundabouts).. There was one night that even our taxi got confused in the area! I suggest you get the satellite version map in google and have the hotel's number ready with you.. they would be happy to give you directions...

Reviews.Title: “NYE at Metro - Staff was second to none”
Reviews.Author: damieniz1
Reviews.Content: Like all my hotel reviews, I base my rating relative to the price paid. Given it was New Years and i manage to book this hotel at $90 USD a night, it was a steal. However, had i paid $150+ I would've been highly disappointed. The hotel just didn't give you that clean feeling. Arrived rather late at night, check-in was quick and easy. Hotel staff was the highlight of the property. Treated guests like you were at a 5-star hotel. The apartment/hotel itself was spacious and had all the necessities for a long stay. I just never got the 'clean' feeling of this hotel. Arrived to no towels (they didn't have any until the morning) and a few stains on the couches, rugs, etc...But given my rate and the going rate of hotels during this time of year, it was fine. Another huge downfall was no wifi. They had wired internet, but come on, spend a few hundred dollars for wifi. hotel staff was great, hotel itself was so-so and the location left a little to be desired. If i could do it again i would've picked somewhere closer to the beach areas or downtown dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 9 days at Metro”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromCA
Reviews.Content: I have been to Dubai many times but this was the first time I spent anytime in the Al Barsha area. Normally I am only in town for a few days, but with 9 days on this trip I decided I wanted to be near the Marina and I was looking for a good price. I found both of them with Metro but was worried "you get what you pay for". I was surprised. The hotel is new, clean and very nice. It is not a 5 star hotel, but then again neither is the price. I would give this hotel 4 stars and I would stay again. The location is near the mall (but a bit hard for some taxis to get to) and there are empty lots around it. I was able to walk 7 minutes to the Metro or take a taxi (always was able to get one out front). The only thing this hotel lacks is the grand restaurants and over the top service. I found the restaurant very nice, the bar friendly and the front office staff very nice and helpful. Frankly I think it is one heck of a deal and my only fear is that the more people that find this place, eventually the prices will rise. Happy I spend 9 days with them.

Reviews.Title: “Staff does not care”
Reviews.Author: Alexia C
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a few weeks. The staff simply does not care. If it happened and you forget a belonging in the room after you check-out simply forget it! Nobody from the staff takes any responsibility for anything! Also the laundry service they are using is crap. I had several of my clothes damaged even teared and of course the hotel did not do any damn thing. Obviously will never visit that hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Management; Absolutely No Concept of Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: cibalom
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious, and the location was convenient to Mall of the Emirates/Metro. However: 1. After a four-and-a-half hour drive from Muscat, it took more than 30 minutes to check in, even though we had a credit-card confirmed and guaranteed booking. 2. It took an additional 15 mintes after check-in for the extra bed to be brought in, even though we had specifically requested it in the booking. Staff did not care that we were already extremely tired after a long drive, and didn't offer any refreshments while we waited. While being charged an extra AED150/day for the exxtra bed, it was so unconfortable that none of us could sleep on it, and instead rearranged the cushions from the sofa on the ground. 3. Internet is ridiculously expensive and SLOW (transfer rates of dial-up) for AED20/hour, AED100/day). 4. The hotel charges AED50 for an replacement keycard, and can only issue ONE KEY PER ROOM (RIDICULOUS!) 5. Front desk staff is completely incompetent -- when called and asked for manager, was told to hold and no one responded for more than 10 minutes. Then realized we had been hung up on! When we called back, the staff said the manager was not in that day! 6. While trying to get ready to go out one night, we requested 3 extra bath towels at 6PM. Front desk/housekeeping responded that there were NONE AVAILABLE, as all their towels were still in the laundry! HOW RIDICULOUS IS THAT!?! Didn't end up getting the towels till 1AM! When raised this issue with management during checkout (when we were finallly able to get ahold of Mr Iqbal) he was belligerent and uncompromising, offering insincere apologies and no explanations. Overall, stay away from this poorly managed property and completely incompetent staff (including all properties managed by ETA Star Hospitality)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodation and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pompey1001
Reviews.Content: We booked this apartment with some reservations because of the location, as when we have previously stayed in Dubai, we have been more central. These apartments are beautiful, they are well maintained and I would say that they are without doubt four star English standards. The only thing we missed was a swimming pool. The apartments are only a few minutes from the metro, which takes you all over Dubai. Taxis are also cheap. The rooms are so reasonable at the hotel , that I would use this as a base, if you are on a budget, but it is not cheap and chearful. So if you want to do the tourist things hop on a metro. If you want to relax on the beach, get a cab and ask the driver for Umm Sequim beach, it is right next to Al Burg. This beach has no sun beds or sunshades. We watched some people take their own tents and sun shades. (we will do this next year , because we plan to go back to these apartments) It costs £4 there in a taxi and £4 back. Although there is a kitchen, there is a chinese and thai restaurant within a few yards. So we got takeways. (be warned through the chinese takeaways are massive, so order half , what you would do in the UK.) We stayed at these apartments for four days before staying at the Al Qsar, and we were not disapointed. (make sure that you get a business card off the reception, because some taxi drivers had difficulty finding it, but the hotel will provide you with a map)

Reviews.Title: “don't care attitude”
Reviews.Author: VassaDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and left 3 golden-diamond rings in the bathroom. During check-out time they told us everything was fine. After couple of hours I realised that my rings were left there. When I called the receptionist and asked about the case he was unhelpful and rude and said that nothing was found. Finally we were contacted the housekeeping executive who told that he checked with the staff and nobody addmited that they took them (but Im 100% assured that rings were left in the bathroom near the sink).....its sooooo sad and unprofessional........Watch out your valuable things if still want to check-in in this thiefty property....:-((((((((((((((((((((((((

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence, no unpleasant surprises here.”
Reviews.Author: Hydezana
Reviews.Content: We stopped over for 3 nights with 3 young children (5,3,1) and 3 adults from Auckland to London. We had a great deal for 2 double rooms and I was more attracted by its close proximity to Emirates Mall where I knew we can eat, entertain the kids and spend our time enjoying our limited time in Dubai. We arrived at 10:00 am and was told our rooms were not ready and that standard check-in time was 14:00. I mentioned that I requested early check-in because I was travelling with 3 young children. The reception were polite and said they will try to confirm when a room will be available which was dependent on other guests checking-out. The Front Office Manager Mr. Namdar then appeared and took charge of the situation, seeing 3 little kids he immediately upgrade us to 3 bedroom apartment checking with me first if it suited our needs. We were provided with a cot and we were in the room within 35 minutes of arriving. The rooms are huge, spotless and comfortable. We had restful sleep with no noise issues. The hotel provided complimentary water bottles and we were grateful for these on our first day. The hotel is 10 minutes walk to Emirates Mall and this has to be the major attraction as we did not have to hunt for taxis when we wanted to come and go (usually a problem coming back late at night in Dubai from some Malls). Emirates Mall has an indoor Ski Arena, Magic World as well as shops/restaurants which provided great entertainment for our kids. You could also buy all types of fresh food(excellent fruits) from Carrefour Super Market and take back to the hotel which has a full size kitchen including washer/dryer. The only item to note is that this hotel will not have views if thats what you are looking for. The staff were attentive/polite, the manager reassuringly customer focussed and our stay was enhanced by their efforts. We will stay again at the Star Metro Al Barsha.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: zwiet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barsha for three nights for an Emirates Airlines stopover on our way to Kuala Lumpur. Be aware that not all taxidrivers can find this place. But it's close -walkable- to the Emirates Mall, so good location, although there is still a lot of construction going on around the hotel, which was noisy at times. The only problem we experienced were the hot showers, even turned to 'cold' all the way they were still to hot in both bathrooms ! This is due of the fact the watertanks are on the roof and with summerly +45 degrees these heat up too much. The front desk advised us to fill the bathtub and let the water cool down....this worked but I tend to prefer a shower. Overall the rooms were great size, clean and cool.Sitting near the window I could even pick up a Wifi signal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: snow_gemm
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived, to see the bright and welcoming smile of the receptionist. We found our way to our room and immediately plonked on the oh-so-soft bed for a quick nap before we began our exploration. The spacious room was well furnished and there was a nice little kitchen with every imaginable pot, pan and utensil. The stay was comfortable. The receptionists were ever-smiling and were able to guide us very well, no matter what query we had. They helped us book a Dhow cruise and a desert safari. We were very happy to find the Mall of the Emirates at close proximity and were able to walk across every morning for shopping or to take a metro to other locations. The breakfast was plentiful and the service impeccable. There was a well-equipped gym, but we never tried it out. Dubai is too exciting to waste time indoors! Stay here if you are looking for a comfy place to head back to after a day out. Don't expect a host of things-to-do, e.g., the pool was not functional, not that we were looking to swim! Call ahead for any queries you may have, as the receptionist is more than willing to give you an idea of what you can expect at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: llisa110rry
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my son for Mother's Day weekend. The main points are: Excellent location : 5-10 minute stroll from the Mall of the Emirates and the nearest Metro Station. (You enter/exit the MoE on the Ski Dubai side - walk along the road toward The Dunes Hotel, then next left and it's on the right.) Excellent, very kind and helpful staff : what more can I say on that? Phenomenally large accommodation : HUGE bedroom (comfy KS bed!) with en suite, separate lounge with dining area and balcony and very adequate kitchen facilities. Also a "guest bathroom" off the hall. I shall certainly recommend this hotel to all and sundry. Just a note, go to the hotel's own website, download and print the little location map from there and take it with you in case you need to ask directions. Thank you to James and the team for making my stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Dbirkwood
Reviews.Content: I booked via Expedia and was really impressed with the hotel, its location and staff. Its not one of the large swanky resort style places but if you want a city base near one of the main malls but with the feel that you actually live there, then this is the one. For £70 per night I had what was really a one bedroom flat! Lobby with sofa and wc, bedroom with kingsize bed, flat screen tv and ensuite plus a balcony, fully equipped kitchen with everything you'd need plus washing machine, 4 seater dining table area and sofa and chairs with another flatscreen tv and then a balcony...amazing value!! There is a food shop across the road and restaurants nearby plus a 10 min walk to the Mall of the Emirates for the Big Bus tour and Carrefour supermarket. I liked the idea that it wa a residential area and you really felt as though it was your home. As you'd expect, there were lots of building work around the building itself but I didn't get disturbed by any early morning noise so that wasn't a problem anyway. Not glorious views from your windows but fascinating just watching everybody going about their business. I got a taxi from the aiport...there were so many of them and it was the fastet taxi line I have ever been in. Twenty minutes later and we arrived at the hotel and it cost of 60 Dirham (about £13).

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, staff and location.....”
Reviews.Author: SallyBray
Reviews.Content: We booked for 4 nights as a stopover on our way home from a trip to Egypt and as the price was very reasonable we were expecting the apartments to be very basic but luckily we were wrong. We were very excited when we entered our room to find a large and very clean apartment with an ensuite off the separate generous sized bedroom, a guest toilet off the hall, separate well appointed kitchen with a washer/dryer and good sized refrigerator as well as a large dining and lounge area. There were also flat screen TVs in both the lounge and the bedroom. Even though there was construction going on all around us we never had any problem with noise. The location is fantastic with a small but well stocked supermarket over the road and only a few minutes walk to the Mall of the Emirates. There is a metro train station at the Mall which makes travelling around Dubai much easier. We found the reception, restaurant, concierge and housekeeping staff very friendly and helpful. The lady at reception went out of her way to help us during our stay, especially with the booking of our desert safari tour and even reconfirmed our onward flight. The building is a fairly hard to find and some taxi drivers needed assistance to find their way, either from their colleages or us once we got to know the area better but it was never a great problem. It is a pity that there are no proper street names in that area - it would make locating the property so much easier. Maybe that will come when there are more completed buildings. I would highly recommend this property and already have to our travel agent and other people we have spoken to and will be staying there again as we hope to have more visits to the incredible city of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: sattamangel
Reviews.Content: its in short words HEVEAN so cozy and relaxing plus it has a great location right behind the uae mall, the stafe are so kind and nice

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Space, Well Located and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: etravelcho
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a business trip to Dubai and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I was given a one-bedroom apartment (this is an apartment hotel) with a sitting room, dinning area as well as a well equipped kitchen with washing machine - plenty of space. I stocked up the fridge with drinks bought from a small supermarket right opposite the hotel. The team at the hotel was very helpful and friendly. They organised airport pickup for me both ways (from Abu Dhabi Int'l Airport). It took me 25 minutes to the Convention Centre and therefore very convenient. It was only an hour from Abu Dhabi airport. Breakfast is served in the cafe area and there is no restaurant for dinner. However, they do offer room service, with a good choice, if required. I found a Thai takeaway round the corner as well. Having said that, I spent every evening out at the food courts at the Hall of Emirates (the one with indoor snowy ski slope) trying all sorts of cooking and then walked back to the hotel - a 10 minute walk. The surrounding area has a lot of building sites but it is the same everywhere in Dubai at the moment. The sound proof was good as I did not hear anything. There was a gym and sauna and a steam room at the top floor although I did not use the facilities. Internet access was availabile free and I made good use of it.

Reviews.Title: “five stars for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: peteraquilla
Reviews.Content: arriving late not knowing what to expect,we were suprised at the size of the rooms,the large bedroom with ensuite plus another bathroom off the hall,fitted kitchen with washer/dryer,small bacony unfurnished but a great view of the building work opposite,we counted 13 cranes at various sites all around the hotel,but because of the weather ,rained everyday!! dust and sand was not a problem,a 5 minute walk to the Mall of the Emirates to buy food at the large " Carrefour" supermarket,kitchen had 2 hobs and a microwave so catering /cooking was possible,self catering,crockery and utensils,the reception staff and housekeeping was very polite and helpful,tv in quite large sitting room but only 3 english channels BBC and Hallmark...but hey,we didn't stay here to watch TV..side lighting and standard lamps plus ceiling lights,will stay here again...and again ..

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: BahrainMonty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Star Metro Al Barsha and can't say anything negative at all. Excellent appartment, friendly and helpful staff and a great location for visiting the Mall of the Emirates and Madinat Jumeirah. Highly recommended as the best value for money I have found in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: charlotteA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one week. The apartment was cheap by dubai standards, we paid £650 for a duluxe - the bed was so big I couldn't even tell my boyfriend was in the bed! The air conditioning was fantastic, it has everysingle thing you need, a fully fitted out kitchen with washer/dryer iron with board ect. You really feel like your home, we had two full size bathrooms! the rooms were cleaned and sheets changed every single day, morning papers were given to you, and the staff are very very friendly and professional. Now - the downside!! No taxis know where it is, but you find this allot as Dubai is growing so much. The food is absolutely terrible, don't waste your money, just go out, or go to Carrefour a supermarket in the mall of emirates! And there is no swimming pool! But we were there on business it suited out needs very well, I would definately stay there every single time... if it just had a pool. Would definately recommend if you do not want to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “home sweet home”
Reviews.Author: palfarsi
Reviews.Content: T’was my first time in Dubai and my friend told me about this newly established hotel apartment, which is located near the mall of emirates (more or less 5 mins. walk)—very accessible and I’m kinda intrigued what the apartment looks like. So there I went to Star Metro Al Barsha and was pretty satisfied with the room and end up spending a week there. Everything is okay. I honestly felt like I'm not away from home because it feels like I am home. Everything that I needed was there be it spoon and fork to pots and bowls. I could even do my own laundry and iron it my self. I have my own hair dyer which is actually a must-have for women. Air conditioning works properly and a very comfortable king size bed (I got the deluxe bedroom apartment). The apartment is really spacious! High-speed Internet Access. Breakfast available and yummy too! I can use the gym anytime and there's a complimentary shuttle to the mall of emirates, which is really a good thing because taxi drivers are hesitant to take you to the Mall from the Hotel due to the less distance involved. And above all, service is very good... oh no... superb is a better word! I had a good response from the staffs every time I need assistance. They have a very polite and friendly atmosphere and well-trained staffs. All in all, I have no regrets staying in this hotel and if I happen to go back in Dubai, Star Metro Al Barsha is the first hotel apartments on my list to stay.#

HotelInfo.Name: Star Metro Al Barsha
HotelInfo.Address: Al Barsha 1 | Behind Mall Of the Emirates, Dubai 185323, United Arab Emirates
